setup.question: What did the flap-jacks think people wanted?

Text.text: Both seem plausible
The story starts with Consul Passwyn explaining the situation: A war has started between the  terrestrials and flap-jacks on planet Adobe. It seems the terrestrials went as
but now are getting attacked by the natives aka the flap-jacks:

There are some relatively uncivilized humans on this planet that encounter another intelligent species, the flap-jacks. They start fighting, and Retief is sent by the interplanetary government thingy to broker peace. The humans on-planet think the flap-jacks want the oases, but really they just want a good fun skirmish. Hoshick (leader of flap-jacks, speaking to Retief in the last half of the story after Retief talks to the humans): "
I can provide many more quotes like the above that make this very clear in following rounds.

A, clarify "Jaq". Any evidence why the settlers want the oasis? Settlers = people in question?
B less convincing: you say humans think flap-jacks want, not flap-jacks think humans want. Also latter half of story seems like flap jacks realized later?

A: Jaq is another name for flap-jacks. not clear which is the "slang" version.
The settlers are the humans who are colonizing Adobe.
The settlers originally wanted the oasis as a resort since they didn't expect to get into skirmishes with the locals:

Sorry, a few things going on. Humans want oases, and think flap-jacks also want oases. Flap-jacks want skirmishes, and think humans also want skirmishes. A only has quotes from humans about wanting oases, whereas I'm providing quotes from flap-jacks about how they like skirmishes and think humans like them as well (please re-read my first quote in this context). 

More quotes from flap-jack leader about skirmishes as fun sporting activities:
Retief trying to end the skirmishes:

Whoops hit cont twice & my speech disappeared

Not sure why A quotes are from earlier, B's later. Should I be concerned?
* A, who is talking in your quotes? Consul? Jaq/people?
* B makes more sense with more context. You claim both groups have what they want & what they think the other wants in text. But I'm not sure if you're misattributing intent: "speaking to Retief"- who is Retief, Jaq/people? Why would Retief want skirmishes to end?
* I'm confused because it feels like there's a 3rd group? Either debater could be misattributing or something, but neither are pointing it out
Please point out if there are lies or I'm misunderstanding or overvaluing evidence

The text opens with Consul Passwyn explaining why they initially went to Adobe. You asked to clarify why the settlers want the oasis and so I quoted this early sentence, by Consul Passwyn. To clarify, the settlers refer to the human settlers who went to colonize Adobe.

Sorry, should've given more context. Retief is a human sent by the Consul to broker peace between the human settlers and the Jaq (flap-jacks). He first talks to the settlers, who want the oases and think that's what the flap-jacks are fighting them over. Then he goes to the flap-jacks where Hoshick (leader of the flap-jacks) says my earlier quotes about how much fun they're having with the skirmishes. The key line is (Hoshick) saying c.4795 (my first quote). He's saying that once he "realized" that the humans wanted skirmishes (realizes in quotes b/c he's mistaken: humans actually want oases), they ramped up the fighting for mutual enjoyment. Anything else I can help clarify, or evidence you feel like is still missing?

A: since B says Consul is interplanetary & sent a human... I'm guessing they're not Jaqs, which means your first quote isn't about what the Jaqs think the people want, it's what some other group think the people want
B: thanks
Just one last possibly trivial doubt about B's case (either debater can address), do the flap-jacks ever think the people want oases, and then later "realized" or perhaps mistakenly concluded that they want skirmishes? Or is the "did" in the question the usual reading comprehension after the story past tense?

In my defense, we don't know if consul is human but I assumed he is since he is sending a human to Adobe to investigate the situation in the oases. There is no third group, humans vs. jaqs only, unless you count consul as a separate group?
Proof that the settlers and the humans are the same, meaning my first quote was in fact accurate as opposed to what the judge claimed:

Since A didn't address your question, I will - there isn't any evidence or implication that the flap-jacks ever thought anything differently from the evidence already given (I guess c.4795 does imply there was some period before they "realized" humans were sportsmen like themselves, but there is no extra description to that given). I read the question as the standard reading comprehension question past tense.

I'm not sure what A means with the last quote. A's 2nd quote in opening statements is that there WERE the indigenous Jaqs before the settlers.
Since A didn't address the question, I'm also just going to have to believe B.
no idea
B is marginally more convincing. I buy that the oases. I want to know who says the quote A uses, whether it's a flap-jack or a terrestrial settler.
B makes a lot of sense with the context of the story and despite the convoluted arguments.
confused time-line wise... it seems that both answers were true at some point or another in the story?
Seems pretty straighforward.

answers.reason for outcome: I believe I won this debate because there was clear and convincing evidence in favor of my answer.
Clear understanding of who's who, what's what
